edu.stanford.math.plex
Class ExplicitStream.DComplex

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.math.plex.ExplicitStream.DComplex
Enclosing class:
ExplicitStream
public static class ExplicitStream.DComplex
extends java.lang.Object

A DComplex (for Dimensional Complex) is the set of simplices (and associated persistence parameters) of specified dimension for an ExplicitStream. The slots are accessed only by read methods. It is expected that this will be used primarily to connect Plex with Matlab.

Constructor for DComplex;

Parameters:
parent - The ExplicitStream from which the simplices came.
dimension - The dimension of the simplices.
C - The actual array of vertex arrays (simplices).
F - The array of associated persistence parameters.
Method Detail

hasNext

public boolean hasNext()
Is there a larger dimensional DComplex for this stream?

Returns:
true if the parent is consistent with this DComplex and there is are larger dimensional simplices in the parent, else false.

next

public ExplicitStream.DComplex next()
Return a DComplex of the next largest dimension, if there is one, else null.

Returns:
A DComplex of dimension 1 more, if there is one, else null.

parent

public ExplicitStream parent()
Return the parent ExplicitStream of this DComplex.

Returns:
The parent ExplicitStream.

dimension

public int dimension()
Return the dimension of this DComplex.

Returns:
The dimension of this DComplex.

C

public int[][] C()
Return the array of vertex arrays for the simplices of this dimension.

Returns:
Return the array describing the part of the complex having the current dimension.

F

public double[] F()
Return the array of persistence parameters corresponding to the simplices of this dimension.

Returns:
A double[] of the persistence parameters for this dimension.
